fqa.title: Frequently Asked Questions
fqa.description: Find answers to common questions about Englishome's learning approach and platform.

questions.question: How does the daily learning structure work?
questions.answer: Each day, you will complete a set of activities designed to build your skills progressively. This includes reading, listening, speaking, and writing exercises.

questions.question: What levels are available?
questions.answer: We offer six levels from A1 (Beginner) to C2 (Proficient). Each level is designed to help you master the language step by step.

questions.question: Can I track my progress?
questions.answer: Yes! You can monitor your daily progress, achievements, and areas needing improvement through our analytics dashboard.

questions.question: Is there a mobile app?
questions.answer: Yes! Our platform is accessible on both desktop and mobile devices, allowing you to learn anytime, anywhere.

LEVEL_A1.title: Beginner
LEVEL_A1.description: Learn the basics of English. Understand simple phrases, introduce yourself, and engage in short conversations.

LEVEL_A2.title: Elementary
LEVEL_A2.description: Communicate in everyday situations. Talk about your daily routine, shopping, and basic personal information.

LEVEL_B1.title: Intermediate
LEVEL_B1.description: Discuss familiar topics. Understand the main points of clear standard input on familiar matters.

LEVEL_B2.title: Upper Intermediate
LEVEL_B2.description: Engage in conversations on a variety of topics. Understand the main ideas of complex texts.

LEVEL_C1.title: Advanced
LEVEL_C1.description: Express yourself fluently and spontaneously. Understand a wide range of demanding texts.

LEVEL_C2.title: Proficient
LEVEL_C2.description: Understand virtually everything heard or read. Summarize information from different spoken and written sources.

PhrasalVerbsPage.title: Phrasal Verbs
PhrasalVerbsPage.definition: Phrasal verbs that consist of a verb + a preposition / an adverb and a preposition
explanations: Phrasal verbs cannot be treated as separate parts but as a whole.
The difference between phrasal verbs and verbal phrases is that verbal phrases are verbs consisting of a verb and a pronoun.

IdiomsPage.title: Idioms
IdiomsPage.definition: Idioms are phrases that have a figurative meaning different from their literal meaning
explanations: Idioms are often used in everyday conversation and writing.
They can be difficult to understand for non-native speakers.
